discussion.content:
The correct answer is:

D. Create a report using the Case Lifecycle report type.

Explanation:
Case Lifecycle report type tracks how much time a case has spent in each status during its lifecycle. This provides the manager with clear visibility into where cases are getting delayed.
Why the other options are incorrect:
A. Create a report using the Case Age report type: This only shows the total age of a case, not the time spent in each status.
B. Create a report using the Case Historical Trending report type: Historical Trending shows changes over time but doesn’t provide detailed insights into time spent in each status.
C. Create a report using the Case Snapshot report type: Snapshots provide point-in-time data but do not track time spent in statuses throughout the lifecycle.
Answer is B: https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.reports_historical_setup.htm&language=en_US&type=5

choices.D: Create a report using the Case Lifecycle report type.
choices.B: Create a report using the Case Historical Trending report type.
choices.C: Create a report using the Case Snapshot report type.
choices.A: Create a report using the Case Age report type.
